meanings.definition: Washed or leached out by the action of a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The lixiviated soil was left barren and dry after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent2: The scientist observed the lixiviated minerals at the bottom of the test tube.
meanings.sent3: The lixiviated sponge was so clean, it practically sparkled!
meanings.sent4: Her lixiviated worries were washed away by the soothing music.
meanings.sent5: The lixiviated colors of the sunset painted the sky in pastel hues.

meanings.definition: To extract or dissolve by washing.
meanings.sent1: She carefully lixiviated the salt from the seaweed before cooking.
meanings.sent2: The laundry detergent lixiviated the stubborn stains from the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The chef lixiviated the flavors from the herbs to create a delicious sauce.
meanings.sent4: His words lixiviated the truth from the tangled web of lies.
meanings.sent5: The rain lixiviated the memories from the dusty corners of her mind.
